Full Stack Software Developer - Senior - Operations Team

We are looking for a skilled and resourceful Senior Full stack Software Developer to join the rapidly expanding Cozey team. We are seeking a builder with outstanding problem solving skills, who is excited to be part of a growing Canadian start-up with very large ambitions.

Being a part of the Cozey tech team is more than writing code, or executing against our roadmap. We are looking for individuals who are builders, and problem solvers - who want to have a direct impact on ideating, and creating software solutions that improves and streamlines Cozey’s entire backend operations.

At Cozey, our vision is to become the world's leading furniture company, and we're looking for someone who shares our passion for building things and creating wonderful customer experiences. We utilize data to constantly learn, improve, and adapt. We foster an environment where everyone is encouraged to share their ideas, push boundaries, take risks, and witness their visions come to life. We want to give you all the tools you need to be successful and achieve your professional and personal goals.

What You'll Be Doing:

Be responsible for full cycle development, including coding, testing, debugging, and deploying software, and features that streamline Cozey's backend operations
Help maintain and scale dev ops infrastructure to support growth
Assist and work closely with CTO and stakeholders to help analyse, design and build software solutions to improve operations
Lead junior developers, and help improve code integrity throughout projects

What We're Looking For:

5+ years of web development experience working with Javascript, React JS and Next JS
5+ years of experience working with Node JS, and related frameworks
2+ years experience working with Shopify & Shopify Plus. Solid understanding of Shopify APIS (Storefront, Admin, etc)
Experience building large scale enterprise applications 
Experience in DevOps, Redis, Queuing is a nice to have
You have expert-level understanding of Shopify’s technical limitations, workarounds and demonstrate a clear understanding of a the clear technical aspects of Shopify
You have an expert-level understanding of Shopify’s Admin System, including shop creation, launch, and management.
Resourceful, builder mindset
Strong problem solving and learning skills
Applicants must be Canadian citizens or permanent residents

What We Offer:

Competitive salary dependent on experience (120K-165K$)
Flexible hybrid work environment to suit your needs
Generous paid time off (4 weeks)
Group insurance starting after 3 months of employment
Dynamic and inclusive work culture
Dog-friendly office space
Opportunity to rapidly expand your career with a fast-growing start-up
If you're ready to join us on our mission to build the best customer experience in furniture and help create a world where everyone can feel at home, we'd love to speak with you!
